page.title: 20FARMS-W.WRATTING & W.WICKHAM
page.content: There are 8 main farms in the survey area and of these Weston Woods is owned by Lord Vestey and run as part of a business empire and Park Farm is the home farm of West Wratting Park. Three farms within the area and one on its southern border are moated farms one of which dates back to Saxon times. The moats survive as tree- filled depressions. The main crops are oilseed rape, winter wheat, spring barley, beans (for animals) and sugar beet. Very few animals are kept and most of the farms have an industrial appearance with storage for large scale machinery and crops.Farming is highly mechanised and the scale of combine harvesters and other machinery favours large fields. Many show signs of old field boundar- ies where hedges and trees have been removed.Most farms have some woodland.
